intro: Scorzonera veresczaginii, commonly known as the Transcaucasian scorzonera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, including parts of Georgia, Armenia, and Azerbaijan. The plant features hairy, elongated leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers with prominent central disk florets. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Scorzonera veresczaginii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
